title: Owl

adjectives: Having or prompted by wisdom or discernment
nouns: Ability to apply knowledge or experience or understanding or common sense and insight
Ability to make a decision based on the combination of knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding.
Deep understanding of or knowledge of a subject
The ability to make a decision based on the combination of knowledge, experience, and intuitive understanding.
Wisdom is the ability to think and act using knowledge, experience, understanding, common sense, and insight.
Warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrates characterized by feathers and forelimbs modified as wings
Birds are feathered, winged, two-legged, warm-blooded, egg-laying vertebrates.
Any of the bipedal, warm-blooded vertebrates that lay eggs having wings which, for most species, enables them to fly.
Feathered, winged, bipedal, endothermic, egg-laying, vertebrate animal
Birds are bipedal, warm-blooded, oviparous vertebrate animals characterized primarily by feathers, forelimbs modified as wings, and hollow bones.
A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs.
Any of various birds of prey of the order Strigiformes that are primarily nocturnal and have forward-looking, binocular vision, limited eye movement, and good hearing.
Owls belong to the order Strigiformes, constituting 200 extant bird of prey species.
Nocturnal bird of prey with hawk-like beak and claws and large head with front-facing eyes
A solitary, mainly nocturnal bird of prey, belonging to the order Strigiformes; it has large forward-facing eyes and ears and a hawk-like beak, and it can turn its head 180 degrees around.

Owls, birds of the order Strigiformes, include about 200 species of mostly solitary and nocturnal birds of prey typified by an upright stance, a large, broad head, binocular vision and binaural hearing, and feathers adapted for silent flight.

description:
An owl, the hooting, large-eyed bird. Depicted as a brown owl with its head facing forward. Shown with large, round, gold-rimmed eyes, talons, tucked wings, and horn-like tufts of feathers.

May be used to represent wisdom. Once popularly used in connection with the hip-hop artist Drake.

Microsoft’s owl previously resembled a barn owl, Samsung’s was purple.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the owl emoji is depicted with large, inquisitive eyes that seem to gleam under soft, realistic lighting, showcasing Apple's signature 3D shading. Its feathers are rendered with subtle gradients and smooth textures, giving it a wise and gentle appearance that's both charming and approachable. This nocturnal creature, often associated with wisdom and knowledge, is a delightful addition to messages on Apple devices, conveying thoughtfulness or a sense of quiet observation.
